intro: Hemizonia parryi subsp. rudis, commonly known as the roughleaf hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in compound umbels. Hemizonia parryi subsp. rudis is valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its ornamental potential in arid gardens.
